intro: Torularia torulosa, commonly known as the yellow cup fungus, is a member of the Ascomycota phylum and is characterized by its distinctive yellow, cup-shaped fruiting bodies. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as decaying wood and leaf litter, where it plays a role in nutrient cycling. The plant's morphology includes a smooth, often resinous surface and a central stalk that may bear spore-producing structures. It is commonly found in temperate regions and is often associated with hardwood trees. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to mycologists and fungal enthusiasts.
